title: Michael Zargari
text:
In my free time, I like contributing to the Persian Jewish community. Currently, I am working with the Jewish Languages Project researching ancient Judeo-Persian Languages, a project that has led to very interesting theories and newly discovered concepts.
Below are a few videos that I have worked on to transliterate and translate from the target language to English and Farsi.


 Jewish Languages Project
January 2022 - Present


Projects:

Judeo-Esfahani Interview (In progress: 2023)
Judeo-Esfahani Eelanoot Discussion (2022)
Judeo-Kermani Conversation (2022)
Judeo-Esfahani Song (2022)
Judeo-Tuyserkani Interview (2022)


Links:

Article on the Jewish Languages Project

title: Education
text:
I graduated with a  Master of Environmental Data Science from the  Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at the University of California-Santa Barbara (UCSB). I was selected as an inaugural Putnam Promise Fellow and was honored with the University Award of Distinction at the end of my program.

I completed my undergraduate degree from UCSB in 2022 with a B.S. in Statistics and Data Science, B.A. in Economics, and minors in Iranian Studies and Translation Studies. I started my academic career in 2018 as a Judith Stapelmann Scholar and was awarded the Jeremy D. Friedman Memorial Award in June 2022 for my avid involvement on campus.

I studied abroad at the University of Edinburgh during Fall 2021 which solidified my interest in pursuing a higher degree in data science.

I have further outlined my educational history below! Feel free to read on.









Master of Environmental Data Science

Class of 2023
Awards:  Putnam Promise Fellowship (2022) |  University Award of Distinction (2023)
 Highlighted Coursework: Databases & Data Management, Machine Learning, Geospatial Analysis & Remote Sensing, Data Visualization & Communication
Bren School of Environmental Science & Management – University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB)







Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Statistics and Data Science
Bachelor of Arts (B.A) in Economics
Minor in Translation Studies | Minor in Iranian Studies

Honors Distinction, Class of 2022
Awards:  Judith Stapelmann Scholar (2018-2022) |  Jeremy D. Friedman Honorary Memorial Award (2022)
University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB)







Study Abroad (2021)

 Highlighted Coursework: Data Science in Ecology and Environmental Science
University of Edinburgh, Scotland

title: Michael Zargari
text:
Welcome
My name is Michael Zargari. Feel free to browse around my website and get to know me.
I am eager to apply my acquired knowledge and skills to a spectrum of real world applications to analyze data, create accurate models, assess risk, and influence climate and environmental policy, among other initiatives.
Note: Any words that are underlined are embedded with links that take you to an external website. Go ahead and click.

title: Experience
text:
On the data side, I have a wide range of experience using Python, R, and SQL. I am currently a Quantitative Risk Analytics Associate at Wells Fargo mitigating model and corporate risk. In the past, I have completed internships at globally recognized companies AIG and Lyft, as well as on-campus research at UCSB where I have worked as a data analyst, data scientist, statistical researcher, underwriter, and actuary.


 

Quantitative Risk Analytics Associate - Wells Fargo

Charlotte, NC
July 2023 - Present

 

Underwriting Intern - American International Group (AIG)

San Francisco, CA
June 2022 - July 2022



Data Analyst Intern – UCSB Office of Budget and Planning

Santa Barbara, CA (Remote)
June 2021 - August 2021



Mental Health Data Researcher – UCSB Department of Economics

Santa Barbara, CA (Remote)
June 2021 - September 2021



Senior Business Analyst – UCSB A.S. Office of the Controller

Santa Barbara, CA
July 2020 - June 2022



Actuarial Intern – Lyft, Inc., Risk Solutions Reserving Team

San Francisco, CA (Remote)
June 2020 - August 2020

title: Michael Zargari
text:
During my time at the University of California, Santa Barbara, I always sought to get more involved alongside my studies to give back to my campus community. This page is a brief overview of the non-data related leadership roles I had on campus.



Student Advisor to the Executive Director of Student Health Services

October 2022 - June 2023




University Center Hub  Assistant Manager

August 2021 - June 2023




University of California Student Health Insurance Plan  Student Caucus Chair  Undergraduate Representative

September 2019 - June 2022


 

Student Fee Advisory Committee  Chair of External Affairs  Graduate Student Representative

September 2019 - June 2023


 

Promise Scholar Advisory Board  Executive Co-Chair  Co-Founder

January 2019 - June 2022
